creator: ZhongY@US.IBM.com
text:
"HTTP Proxy Server" records redundant "HTTP Request" "Server Name" whose only 
difference from "HTTP Request Defauls" is just case.
"HTTP Proxy Server" records "HTTP Request" "Protocol (default http)" 
literal "http" which is redundant since "default http".

Maybe "HTTP Proxy Server" can compare "Server Name" & "Protocol" to "HTTP 
Request Defauls", and "Protocol" to literal "HTTP", case-*in*sensitively.

I followed
    HTTP://jakarta.apache.org/jmeter/usermanual/jmeter_proxy_step_by_step.pdf
to add "HTTP Request Defauls" "Server Name" which has a few upper case 
characters. "HTTP Proxy Server" repeats the "Server Name", in lower case 
though, into all "HTTP Request" records. "default http" is also repeated into 
every "HTTP Request" record.

Thanks!
The proxy is working as designed and documented.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
"Server Name" & "Protocol" are all case-*in*sensitive.

I don't see any design or document mentioning "Server Name" & "Protocol" are 
all case-sensitive. Even if such (internal) design/document exist, they need 
to be revised.
creator: ZhongY@US.IBM.com

text:
Agreed, the documentation does not say explicitly whether matches are case-
sensitive or not.

Given that the process can match arbitrary strings, it would not make sense 
for the default to match case-blind - that could mess up paths. The docs do 
not say that the server name and protocol are treated specially. Just because 
it would be OK to match these particular items case-blind does not make it so.

I'll add some notes to the documentation to make this more obvious.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Path is case-sensitive while server name and protocol are not.
Again, I don't think path can be matched case-blind while I think server name 
and protocol should.

Thanks.
creator: ZhongY@US.IBM.com

text:
I've updated the JMeter documentation to say that matching is case-sensitive.

If you want this to be changed for the appropriate Http Defaults entries, 
please create a new enhancement request.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Change to enhancement as instructed.

Thanks a lot to Sebb for all the prompt responses!
creator: ZhongY@US.IBM.com
